thread.title: Why are there SEVEN Premier League games on transfer deadline day? All you need to know
thread.title_full: Why are there SEVEN Premier League games on transfer deadline day? All you need to know

author: James Whaling
title: Why are there SEVEN Premier League games on transfer deadline day? All you need to know
text:
Sport Why are there SEVEN Premier League games on transfer deadline day? All you need to know Fourteen top-flight sides are in action on Tuesday evening while chairmen and chief executives up and down the country try to get deals over the line Share The Emirates will play host to Arsenal vs Watford on Tuesday (Photo: UEFA/Getty Images) Share     
There are just four days of the January transfer window remaining. 
The winter sales will come to an end at 11pm on Tuesday evening when Premier League teams will be forced to go with what they've got until the end of the season. 
And the more eagle-eyed among you will have noticed there is something slightly different about this particular transfer deadline day - there are as many as SEVEN Premier League fixtures. 
So - the question is - why? 
Wonder no more... Why are there Premier League games on deadline day? Chelsea and Liverpool will clash at Anfield (Photo: Clive Rose) 
Quite simply, it's a scheduling decision. 
Due to cup fixtures and other factors, the Premier League needed a midweek set of fixtures at this time of year, and the week that happened to work best is the one which includes transfer deadline day. 
It is the first time matches will be played on deadline day since 2012. 
There is also a busy night of action in the Championship and a handful of League Two fixtures. Will the games prevent deals from happening? Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
